Hello Jamie,

Regarding the log clean up, you can access System Maintenance -> Audit Log Backup -> Select the log type that you want to include in the backup -> Choose what logs to backup -> Start.
The example below will create a one time backup which will clean up all the logs older than 6 months.
Once the backup is complete you can download the report from the Backup List, found at the bottom of the Audit Log Backup page.
[Image_2024-06-06_21-56-16.png]

Also, the backup can be scheduled to run automatically.
Access System Maintenance -> Audit Log Backup -> Scroll down to "Schedule Backup"
Select the log type that you want to include in the backup -> Choose the frequency for the bakcup -> Choose what logs to backup -> Start.
The example below will create a scheduler backup which will run every month and clean up all the logs older than 6 months.

[Image_2024-06-06_22-13-18.png]


The current EPP Server version will be shown in the bottom right corner of the EPP UI.
And the current EPP Client versions installed on the computers can be found accessing Device Control -> Computers.

Let me know if there is something else I can help you with.

Best regards,

Hello Jamie,

I would suggest to update all the existing machines from the EPP UI by accessing System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade -> Select the latest EPP Client version for Windows -> Next -> Select all the computers -> Next. (You will have to create another upgrade job for the Mac machines.)
This is going to update all the EPP Clients to the latest version once they will receive the update command from the EPP Server.

For the new machines you can download the EPP Client from System Configuration -> Client Software.

If the update fails for some of the machines, I will suggest to manually uninstall the old EPP Client and then to install the new EPP Client.

Please note that for the windows machines you will not be able to install the newer version of the EPP Client on top of the old one. So you will have to uninstall the old EPP Client first and then to install the new EPP Client.
For the mac machines, you can install the new version of the EPP Client on top of the old EPP Client version.

Best regards,
Emil
